document_data.mainbody:
'''Anauroch''' ({{Pronounce|ah|NOR|ach|refs=}} {{Pronounce|alt=yes|an|OAR|ock|h|refs=}} {{Pronounce|alt=yes|a|NAW|rock|refs=}} {{Pronounce|alt=yes|an|OAR|ock|refs=}}), or '''The Great Sand Sea''', was a magical desert in [[North Faerûn|northern Faerûn]]. It held the remnants of the once-powerful [[Netheril|Netherese Empire]], their flying enclaves having crashed to the ground when their greatest mage [[Karsus]], in a desperate bid to end the war against the [[phaerimm]], challenged the goddess [[Mystryl]] for her divine mantle, causing the [[Weave]] to falter and all magic to fail. For generations since, Anauroch, the greatest desert in Faerûn, encroached relentlessly on border nations, burying them beneath the sands.{{Fact}}

{{Quote|''"Desert, but not lifeless. Scorching hot by day, chill at night, but only dunes and hard plain in the south, where the Bedine swing their swords at you and play "I'm fiercer" with any intruder. Cold rock to the north, and more life than you'd think for a land so parched, with old, fell magic beneath your boots and the stony spires of ruins covered and then laid bare by the sands when storms howl, like old teeth sticking up from a buried jawbone.''|Anonymous [[Harper]] agent<ref>{{Cite web/geocities/Ed Says: Geography of the Realms}}}}

Geography.Geographical Features:
;Bodies of Water
* [[River of Gems]]: A long clearwater river that stretched from the southern edge of the [[High Ice]] to the large sinkhole known as [[the Throat (Anauroch)|the Throat]].<ref name=FR13-p61>
* [[Sixstreams River]]: A river that originated from streams flowing west out of the [[Desertsmouth Mountains]]<ref name=FR13> and flowed past the [[D'tarig]] village of [[Tel Badir]].<ref name=FR13-p55>
;Hills & Mountains
* [[Azirrhat]]: Called home by a large population of [[asabi]], these rocky spires were avoided by the [[Bedine]].<ref name=FR13-p47>
* [[El Rahalat]]: This lone peak housed both an oasis and its namesake [[place spirit]], [[Rahalat]].<ref name=FR13-p48>
* [[Hills of Scent]]: These sandy hills were bare of vegetation save gnarled [[frankincense tree|frankincense trees]].<ref name=FR13-p51>
* [[Scimitar Spires]]: This range of mountains earned its name from the blade-like appearance of the mountains.<ref name=FR13-p54>
* [[Swordpoint (peak)|The Swordpoint]]: Though a useful landmark, this soaring peak was a known gathering place for [[manticore|manticores]].<ref name=FR13-p62>
* [[Wall of Fallen Djinn]]: This range of mountains and foothills<ref name=FR13-p57> within the center of the Sword separated a number of regional landmarks.
;Landmarks
* [[At'ar's Looking Glass]]: Distinctive but dangerous, this ‘sea’ of finely-polished stones was located northeast of the [[Scimitar Spires]].<ref name=FR13-p47>
* [[Bowl of Loneliness]]: This immense dune field was situated between the oases of [[El Rahalat]] and [[El Ma'ra]].
* [[Fallen Giant Rift]]: This miles long and several hundred foot deep rift was home to highly territorial [[hill giant|hill giants]] that hunted any who entered their rift by hurling weapons at them.<ref name=FR13-p60>
* [[Helm Rift]]: One of the many rifts that was within the [[Plain of Standing Stones]].
* [[Quarter of Emptiness]]: This stretch of landscape was known to be particularly harsh, being little more than an expanse of open bedrock and sandy dunes, with no plant or animal life to be found.<ref name=FR13-p53>
* [[Saiyaddar]]: This region of lush grasslands was the shared “hunting-lands” of the [[Bedine]].<ref name=FR13-p54>
* [[Shoal of Thirst]]: This large basin is a seemingly endless salt flat, and a place avoided when possible by the local [[Bedine]] people.<ref name=FR13-p54>
* [[Smokeholes]]: These large-round holes in the High Ice were created by lava-heated air deep below ground, and were home to a number of heat-loving monsters.<ref name=FR13-p66>
* [[The Throat (Anauroch)|The Throat]]: This large crater or sinkhole was the terminus of the [[River of Gems]] and was rumored to contain heaps of gemstones at its bottom.<ref name=FR13-p62>
;Oases
* [[Bhaerlith]]: This [[Zhentarim]]-created oasis was rich in date palms and fruit trees, and could be found north of the [[Hills of Scent]]<ref name=FR13-p47>
* [[Bitter Well (Anauroch)|Bitter Well]]: This oasis could be found southwest of [[El Ma'ra]] and the [[Bowl of Loneliness]].
* [[Hlaunga]]: Located south of the [[Scimitar Spires]], this oasis was created by the [[Zhentarim]].
* [[Lion's Eye Oasis]]: Considered the most verdant oasis in the Sword, this oasis was home to a large community of [[lamia]].<ref name=FR13-p51>
* [[Ma'atar]]: Located west of the [[Wall of Fallen Djinn]], this created oasis was bountiful in nut-producing trees.<ref name=FR13-p51>
* [[Oasis of Vipers]]: Largely unvisited by wandering [[Bedine]] due to an infestation of snakes, this grouping of three pools was home to countless desert fauna.<ref name=FR13-p52>
* [[Olomaa]]: Created by the [[Zhentarim]], this oasis was protected by a fiercely loyal [[beholder]].<ref name=FR13-p52>
* [[Sister of Rains]]: This canyon-oasis was the refuge of outcast [[Bedine]].<ref name=FR13-p55>
* [[Vuerthyl]]: Located in the northwest part of the Sword, this man-made oasis was discovered to contain a wealth of [[Emerald|emeralds]] and an [[imprisonment|imprisoned]] [[mind flayer]] wizard.<ref name=FR13-p56>
* [[Well of the Chasm]]: Hidden within the [[Scimitar Spires]], this oasis was commonly used by the [[Raz'hadi]] tribe.<ref name=FR13-p58>
* [[Well of the Cloven Rock]]: This large oasis was located within the [[Hills of Scent]] and, when not used by the [[Bedine]], was occupied by [[Lion|lions]].<ref name=FR13-p58>
* [[Yliyl]]: A relatively minor oasis, the primary thing it was known for was legends of buried treasure.<ref name=FR13-p58>
;Valleys
* [[Alagh's Pass]]: This mountain pass allowed travel through the [[Wall of Fallen Djinn]], between the [[Saiyaddar]] and the [[Hills of Scent]].<ref name=FR13-p47>
* [[Raudilauth]]: This long-dried river valley passed through the [[Desertsmouth Mountains]] and connected the [[Shadow Gap]] to the lands of the [[D'tarig]].<ref name=FR13-p5>

document_data.History:
In {{Yearlink|-34500}}, the [[sarrukh]] empire of [[Isstosseffifil]] rose to prominence. Throughout the [[Days of Thunder]] they ruled much of the land that would one day become Anauroch. Eventually, their empire fell at the hands of the phaerimm and they were forced by the Netherese to scatter.

In {{Yearlink|-461}}, the phaerimm started casting spells in the land of Netheril that eventually caused the creation of Anauroch.

In [[10 DR]], the Netheril region was renamed Anauroch, to reflect the great desert that the region had become.{{Fact}}

In [[329 DR]] the Anauroch desert finally stopped perpetually expanding outward as the sharns defeated the phaerimms.

In [[1038 DR]], the sands of Anauroch began to spread out southward once more.

The arrival of Thultanthar in [[1372 DR]] brought about significant change in the political and geographic landscape of the Anauroch. In that year, three Princes of Shade performed a ritual that created a huge storm above the Shoal of Thirst, and transformed it into the Shadow Sea. For around a year, they used shadow blankets to melt the glacier of the High Ice, before that plan was disrupted.

In [[1385 DR]] the [[spellplague]] caused the merging of [[Abeir]] and [[Toril]], creating changes in the landscape of Faerun, including large areas that collapsed into the underdark.  Changes to the Anauroch were not specified, but a large area of the Frozen Sea was marked as the "Deep Maw" on a map from [[1479 DR]]. <ref>

By [[1479 DR]], the Anauroch was an arid dust bowl spotted with youthful forests. The melted glacier created rivers and grasslands. Rain fell and the temperature was moderated. Some areas had grown lush and verdant.

In [[1485 DR]], Bedine rebels began a concentrated effort to overthrow their Netherese overlords following Netheril's war in [[Cormyr]].

In [[1487 DR]], Thulanthar's cataclysmic destruction in [[Myth Drannor]] signaled the end of the Second Netherese Empire, and by [[1488 DR]] the empire was reduced to a shadow of its former size. By this point Netherese forces and Bedine tribes were in full conflict, warring over key points in the desert. One such battle near the [[Memory Spire]] managed to awaken a hive of phaerimm sleeping within, causing the aberrations to begin leeching life from the land around them.

Some time after [[1485 DR]], the Anauroch was once more a desert.
document_data.Rumors & Legends:
The ruins of the very first [[cloud palace]], belonging to the father of the [[cloud giant]]s, [[Nicias]], were thought to be located somewhere in the great desert.

There was a [[Faerûn]]ian folktale that stated the Anauroch desert was formed by a single [[golem]]. The construct was tasked by its master to shovel sand into the region, but was subsequently forgotten about. After continuing with its task for so long, it was said to have formed the desert.{{Page needed}}

Notable Locations.Empire of Shadows: Returned in [[1372 DR]], [[Thultanthar]], the City of Shadows, was a floating mountaintop, sliced off and inverted, with a city built upon it. It was built centuries past, before the folly of [[Karsus]], and no magic like it survived in Faerûn in the 14th century, as the reincarnated [[Mystra]] restricted mortals from ever again creating such potent spells as the ones that created Shade's ''[[mythallar]]''.{{Fact}}
Notable Locations.Ruins of Hlaungadath: About forty miles east of the ruined city [[Ascore]] on the northwestern border of the desert, another abandoned city rose from the sands. [[Hlaungadath]] was one of the three floating cities that [[Mystra]] saved during the destruction of [[Netheril]]. It was a city that landed near the High Ice and was eventually abandoned. Old but largely intact, the ruins were inhabited by a clan of [[lamia]]s. The lamias stalked the nearby oases, preying on careless Zhentarim or unwary [[Bedine]]. Anyone knowledgeable of the desert knew of the evil of Hlaungadath and gave the ruins a wide berth.{{Fact}}

Inhabitants.Notable Inhabitants:
* [[Telamont Tanthul]], ruler of the Shade Enclave, a powerful shadow archmage.
* The [[Princes of Shade]], the sons of Telamont Tanthul.
* [[Ruha]], a Bedine [[Harper]]. She attempted to capture the Seraph of Lies [[Malik el Sami yn Nasser]] to bring him before a [[High Harper]] court.
